ygData.subject: Re: Pot Molds & Legs
ygData.msgSnippet: A Now that dough is working, yeah! ... heh...they are QUITE confusing ...all these different pottery components...what you need is a SMALL block of clay...a
ygData.messageBody:
A>Now that dough is working, yeah!
>I need to fire ceramic linings to make any Pie, Muffin & Bread Tins.
>Any guesses?
>
>I tried the obvious:
>Flask of Water, Block of Clay, Ceramic Lining Sketch.
>[These components don't combine].

heh...they are QUITE confusing ...all these different pottery
components...what you need is a SMALL block of clay...a "block of clay" is
a medium block though they never tell you that...I failed at many things
doing trial and error ..not to mention I have STILL yet to figure out WHICH
sketch will give me a blasted mixing bowl and all I see are bowl
sketch,large bowl sketch etc ..ahh well ;) ..hope I at least helped with
the ceramic linings ;) ....btw... is baking even worth it? is it any kind
of money maker...or do you simply use it to supply yourself with food
instead of having to buy it?? sorry for rambling..I"m off now ;)


>
>Also could someone please explain metal bits vs block of ore.
>As I've read, two ore can be used to substitute for metal bits,
>but I have yet to be successful. Stacked or unstacked.
>
DO NOT listen to such and such "+" such "=" blah blah...SUPPOSEDLY two
small bricks of ore equals one large brick or whatevert the book
said...well that may be ..however they will NOT work if you try to use two
smalls instead of one large to make whatever item requires a large
brick....i tried many of those different equivelants just to see and got
"these items do not combine in this quanity to make anything" EVERY
time...stick to the exact recipes I found and you'll be okay.

>Cleric Taven
